intro: Ipomoea juramenti, commonly known as the Jerusalem flower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers with five petals, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
